name: 42 Macro
title: Did Consensus Get Too Bearish Too Soon?
text:
Synopsis
The consensus may have become overly bearish prematurely, with potential significant shifts in US fiscal, regulatory, trade, and financing policies creating a wide range of economic outcomes for 2025.

Key Insights
- The authors observe ongoing disinflation in the US, but have doubts about its long-term sustainability
- Expect sticky inflation narrative to potentially become consensus in late Q2 or early Q3
- The authors anticipate a less optimistic fundamental outlook for 2025
- Potential dramatic changes in US policy could trigger further hawkish monetary policy shifts
- The distribution of probable economic outcomes is expanding due to potential policy changes
- The authors recommend systematic risk management over attempting to time market pivots
- Previous research themes by the authors (resilient US economy, soft landing) became consensus and preceded strong S&P 500 performance
